book.author: Orwell, George
book.title: Nineteen Eighty-Four: A Novel
book.description: Thematically, Nineteen Eighty-Four centres on the consequences of totalitarianism, mass surveillance, and repressive regimentation of persons and behaviours within society.

book.author: Huxley, Aldous
book.title: Brave New World
book.description: Largely set in a futuristic World State, whose citizens are environmentally engineered into an intelligence-based social hierarchy, the novel anticipates huge scientific advancements in reproductive technology, sleep-learning, psychological manipulation and classical conditioning that are combined to make a dystopian society which is challenged by only a single individual: the story's protagonist.

book.author: Huxley, Aldous
book.title: The Doors of Perception
book.description: The Doors of Perception provoked strong reactions for its evaluation of psychedelic drugs as facilitators of mystical insight with great potential benefits for science, art, and religion.

book.author: Gibson, William
book.title: Neuromancer
book.description: Set in the future, the novel follows Henry Case, a washed-up computer hacker who is hired for one last job, which brings him up against a powerful artificial intelligence.

book.author: Erickson, Jon
book.title: Hacking: The Art of Exploitation
book.description: Hacking: The Art of Exploitation is a book by Jon "Smibbs" Erickson about computer security and network security.

book.author: Chollet, François
book.title: Deep Learning with Python
book.description: Deep Learning with Python introduces the field of deep learning using the Python language and the powerful Keras library. Written by Keras creator and Google AI researcher François Chollet, this book builds your understanding through intuitive explanations and practical examples.

book.author: Kant, Immanuel
book.title: Critique of Pure Reason
book.description: The Critique of Pure Reason is a book by the German philosopher Immanuel Kant, in which the author seeks to determine the limits and scope of metaphysics.

book.author: Schopenhauer, Arthur
book.title: The World as Will and Representation
book.description: Taking the transcendental idealism of Immanuel Kant as his starting point, Schopenhauer argues that the world we experience around us—the world of objects in space and time and related in causal ways—exists solely as 'representation' (Vorstellung) dependent on a cognizing subject, not as a world that can be considered to exist in itself (independently of how it appears to the subject’s mind).
